snippet: A French journalist who was a hostage in Syria from July 2013 to Dec. 2013 said one of his captors was a Frenchman suspected of later killing four people in Brussels.
abstract: Nicolas Henin, French journalist held hostage for months by extremists in Syria, identifies one of his captors as Mehdi Nemmouche, Frenchman who has been in police custody since May on suspicion of killing four people at the Brussels Jewish Museum.
lead_paragraph: A French journalist who was a hostage in Syria from July 2013 to Dec. 2013 said one of his captors was a Frenchman suspected of later killing four people in Brussels.

headline.main: Hostage Says Suspect in Jewish Museum Killings Was One of His Captors
headline.print_headline: Captor in Syria Said to Be French

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
